column2: America shockingly owes over $6 trillion to these countries
column3: In 2019 America's debt surpassed $22 trillion for the first time ever, as debt has climbed dramatically in the years following 2008's financial crisis. But who owns it? US debt can be bought by anyone through treasury securities (bills, notes or bonds), which represent an IOU from the government to the investor. The US then pays interest every year to service the debts. While much of America's debt is owed domestically, foreign investors hold more than $6 trillion, both through central banks and private funds.

column2: Man found shot in a car in Lake Arbor, Maryland
column3: Prince George's County Police are investigating a homicide that happened on the 1300 block of Lake Arbor Way in Lake Arbor, Maryland on Monday night. Police said officers responded to the shooting call around 10:50 p.m. at the intersection of Lake Arbor Way and Fairlakes Place. At the scene, officers found a man suffering from a gunshot wound inside a vehicle. Officials said the man was later transported to the hospital and was pronounced dead...

column2: US states with shocking debts bigger than some countries
column3: With many state and local agencies unable to fully fund their pensions and healthcare benefits, some states' debt is mounting beyond that of some nations. According to the OECD's most recent debt-to-GDP rankings, Estonia had the lowest debt of any OECD country at 13% of GDP, or a total of $2.5 billion. As you'll see, each state on this list has far more debt than Estonia, and for some states, more than several other countries too. Read on to find out which states are heavily in the red and how much they owe, according to the Census Bureau's most recent figures.

column2: Trump's EPA Moves to Rollback Obama-Era Coal Power Plant Waste Rules

column2: Air Force's X-37B space plane lands after record 780 days in orbit
column3: There was no doubt that the US Air Force's X-37B was going to break its own record for time spent in orbit, but it's now clear by how much. The mysterious Boeing-made space plane has landed at Kennedy Space Center after 780 days in orbit, comfortably surpassing the earlier record of 717 days, 20 hours and 42 minutes.

column2: Broncos QB Joe Flacco has herniated disk in neck, season, possibly career in jeopardy
